Title: Yeah! Unveils Consumer Engagement Campaign: #TasteTheYeahVibe Set to Take Over Social Media
Summary: Yeah! unveils #TasteTheYeahVibe – a fun, vibrant, and interactive movement designed to take over social media . Yeah! is igniting a new wave of consumer excitement with the debut of its nationwide digital engagement campaign . The campaign follows the successful launch of its exciting trio of fruit-infused milk flavoured drinks

Title: Reps panel vows to end revenue leakages in oil, non-oil export
Summary: Reps panel vows to end revenue leakages in oil, non-oil export sectors . House of Representatives Ad-hoc Committee has pledged to halt the massive revenue leakage .

Title: One of 25 abducted Kebbi schoolgirls escapes
Summary: One of the 25 schoolgirls abducted by terrorists from a boarding school in Kebbi State has escaped from captivity and returned home, the school’s principal confirmed . The Guardian can authoritatively report that the bandits launched a deadly attack .

Title: Printer gets life sentence for defiling neighbour’s daughter
Summary: Emmanuel Lakehinde defiled his 11-year-old neighbour’s daughter in a bathroom . A Lagos Sexual Offences and Domestic Violence Court has sentenced him to life imprisonment . Justice Rahman Oshodi convicted him and sentenced him on a two-count count .

Title: Alumni launch N500m revitalisation project, seek Ondo govt partnership
Summary: The Alumni Association of Ahmadiyya Grammar School, Ogbagi-Akoko, in Akoko North-West Local Council of Ondo State, has appealed to the state government to partner with it in revitalising the institution . The association noted that educational institutions have lost their lost glory .

Title: Alleged Genocide: If global pressure will make FG act, so be it — CAN President
Summary: Archbishop Daniel Okoh said the Church has no objection to the rising international scrutiny over attacks on Christian communities . He insisted that global pressure may be the push the Federal Government needs to finally act .

Title: PDP crisis: Tear gas rains as Wike, governors lock horns in 3-hour Abuja standoff
Summary: Wike stays inside his vehicle as tear gas sweeps through PDP secretariat grounds . *Overlapping meeting schedules set off fresh struggle for control inside party . Party leaders escalate their appeals to international community .

Title: Senate to Tinubu: Recruit additional 100,000 men, officials into military
Summary: The Senate has called on President Bola Tinubu and security agencies to urgently rescue 25 students abducted from Government Girls Comprehensive Secondary School in Maga, Kebbi State .

Title: Alleged Genocide: If global pressure will make FG act, so be it — CAN President
Summary: Archbishop Daniel Okoh said the Church has no objection to the rising international scrutiny over attacks on Christian communities . He insisted that global pressure may be the push the Federal Government needs to finally act .

Title: Anambra shuts down school over unsafe learning environment
Summary: The Anambra State Government has ordered the immediate closure of Great Mind Academy in Awka, citing an unfit and unhealthy learning environment . The school was ordered to close by the state government citing an 'unfit and unhealthy' environment .
